sentences.english: I jotted down stray thoughts and memories in the middle of the night.
sentences.chinese: 我將午夜無眠時零散的思緒和記憶隨手記下。

sentences.english: On average throughout all the quarter-million responses, minds were wandering 47 percent of the time.
sentences.chinese: 在25萬迴應中，平均下來思緒47%的時間在遊蕩。

sentences.english: Then, set aside 5 or 10 minutes to focus on quieting your thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 然後，定5至10分鐘來讓你的思緒平靜下來。

sentences.english: Fold the thoughts and wiping open touch in canthus under that bit of tears.
sentences.chinese: 收起思緒，拭開沾在眼角下的那點淚花。

sentences.english: We are likely to be disconcerted by hiatuses of thought.
sentences.chinese: 我們很可能因思緒的中斷而感到困窘。

sentences.english: My mind sheered away from the topic being discussed.
sentences.chinese: 我的思緒突然遠離了正在討論的話題。

sentences.english: My thoughts still cling to the moldering Past.
sentences.chinese: 我的思緒依然牽掛着前塵舊夢。

sentences.english: Thus, ten days where day and night to draft and thoughts on all the Problem.
sentences.chinese: 因此，十天之裏日夜趕稿，思緒全在習題上。

sentences.english: Thoughts may go exotic night souls, in the open on the Makino erratic.
sentences.chinese: 思緒似異域夜走的魂靈，在空曠的牧野上飄忽不定。

sentences.english: I was overwhelmed with all the new things to observe and take into account.
sentences.chinese: 所有新事物都讓我眼花繚亂，思緒萬千。

sentences.english: Blooming love around you in the morning like song or feeling.
sentences.chinese: 讓愛的思緒與歌聲在清晨芳菲。

sentences.english: I was disturbed by he pitter-patter of rain on the roof.
sentences.chinese: 屋頂上淅淅瀝瀝的雨聲擾亂了我的思緒。

sentences.english: Another focus-killer is a head full of scattered thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 另外一個注意力殺手就是滿腦子亂飛的思緒。

sentences.english: Target moved Jianbu thoughts in my mind swiftly.
sentences.chinese: 瞄準感動，思緒在我腦中健步如飛。

sentences.english: Each of them remains in the thoughts and prayers of the American people.
sentences.chinese: 他們每個人都在美國人民的思緒和祈禱中。

sentences.english: Walking along the stairway, walking through lane, standing on the bridge, thinking about everything.
sentences.chinese: 漫步石徑，穿梭小巷，佇立橋頭，思緒紛飛。

definition: singing voice/fig. original voice of a poet
to recount/to tell of/to relate/(fig.) (of a thing) to stand as testament to (some past history)
